elements.2211.03251_9d9066c9be1a030daea573213f14c: Sparse tensor algebra (including linear algebra) is used in many applications, including data analytics
elements.2211.03251_c0c83ae61de6635cfc5076835e3e5: To accelerate sparse computation, hardware designers are developing specialized domain-specific accelerators
elements.2211.03251_b69a9cdb9a788d1b5e4ad8be9e461: Tensor algebra can be used to express a variety of computations
elements.2211.03251_298d238f90e902310588379a57704: However, only a few functions, such as dense matrix multiplication and sparse matrix-vector multiplication, are used widely enough to warrant single-function hardware
elements.2211.03251_89fcea4099f56549495864bfd0851: This leaves a long tail of important tensor computations for which we cannot afford to build single-function hardware, but which would still benefit from performance and energy efficiency improvements beyond what is possible with CPUs and GPUs
elements.2211.03251_39f2867a76766ecf02ae0946ef6ac: Examples include tensor factorization in data analytics
elements.2211.03251_3c0465887bd6cdac8ced209416c79: , and graph analytics expressed as linear algebra
elements.2211.03251_ee0e75fce7df5f37b2f0efbbab480: Kernel fusion enabled by compilers boosts arithmetic intensity
elements.2211.03251_677149bd9a487645075a37478df79: To address the long tail of sparse functions that need to be accelerated, one promising approach is reconfigurable dataflow architectures (RDAs) with support for sparse operations
elements.2211.03251_7c9d6b493909bb6732ed201bd4213: RDAs provide general hardware for combining sparse data streams and for storing sparse temporary data structures on chip
elements.2211.03251_15f85aaf25f07138f5450f855ced9: They can be used to efficiently compute many different sparse linear and tensor algebra expressions
elements.2211.03251_be27b132ef846cec58728aca9b42a: But to date, these architectures have only been programmed directly at the level of their sparse data combiners and physical memories
elements.2211.03251_93fe8c3f2569372abfcf48d18ee72: This means that programming them is not amenable to data scientists and machine learning software developers
elements.2211.03251_755182e6ebddeaafea2c9fd66a03c: Whereas to make RDAs much more accessible, we propose compiling to them directly from sparse tensor algebra expressions, along with a provided schedule, through a library API
elements.2211.03251_79814aed163f7cea20cd91ecfb282: The challenge in compiling to sparse RDAs is managing their memories and controlling the combining of sparse streams of tensor coordinate-value pairs
elements.2211.03251_be3204a5691a7289745d5a90b887e: On CPUs and GPUs, the von Neumann architecture separates control logic from memories and presents the programmer with a convenient pull model
elements.2211.03251_d887d10dc1309339176863cd1e405: when you need data, you ask for it
elements.2211.03251_1576e179367aeda8f0b39f9cb6b3f: But on RDAs the control logic is attached to memories in a push model of computation, where programmers explicitly manage data movement throughout the memory hierarchy
elements.2211.03251_4dce338b527da8a318f287f893dab: These challenges make RDAs harder to program than CPUs and GPUs, which is exacerbated by the complexity of sparse tensor algebra kernels
elements.2211.03251_9ddb584b1260722abf5edbee6719f: And, like TACO, we further separate data representations
elements.2211.03251_1a38a5c90ae61c7b5018b06b977b1: This design lets end users of tensor algebra focus on their application logic, using intuitive linear and tensor algebra expressions exposed as a library
elements.2211.03251_9255ad4442e6470fa14dd1809e1cd: These expressions can then be mapped to a CPU or, using the scheduling and data representation languages, to a dataflow architecture
elements.2211.03251_6f8e0711dc569d621ab5ece9abd7f: Thus, end users and performance engineers can work separately
elements.2211.03251_474156a922ad0dca94a41d2437feb: has been that a clean scheduling language facilitates auto-scheduling research
elements.2211.03251_076da97f09a8eb9d8b9d704b76a7d: and lets performance experts tune code beyond the capabilities of current auto-scheduling systems
elements.2211.03251_69c974ef45e8790550b4b0439d286: In this paper, we describe how to compile arbitrary sparse tensor algebra expressions to Capstan
elements.2211.03251_69c3e72ec7cfd9ac5dc3882e9ba69: The key insight is to use separate languages to describe the tensor expression, the data representations and their placement on the RDA, and the mapping of the sparse iteration space of a tensor expression to sparse hardware.

elements.2211.03251_29acd793d93e161ad9254535d5f48: When compiling to accelerators, the compiler will often need to generate code to manage explicit fixed-length memories
elements.2211.03251_73a329d92a55e08e9d8159dc8fb9b: Hardware accelerators (including GPUs) typically have memory hierarchies with multiple physical memory types that are explicitly managed by software, also called explicit, decoupled data orchestration
elements.2211.03251_9bfec67fcb1bb9c40aa0b64ce1aa0: These memory types often have different capacities, transfer speeds, access patterns, and scopes (notably, only some are host-visible); the compiler must bind data structures to memories and generate transfers between them
elements.2211.03251_d99726c5407ab058b1f5b412e71ee: The different sub-arrays involved in sparse tensors
elements.2211.03251_fde820e5c451073f3694a90aa1065: are also often mapped separately based on a combination of the sub-array and memory properties, complicating the analysis.
elements.2211.03251_fd2f0797934171c04eaf3642b39d2: analyzes the memory needs of format-annotated CIN to generate Spatial kernels for Capstan
elements.2211.03251_8f090c1e528dd35cafb2f6e32a99d: The format abstraction gives end users explicit control over tensor placement for one level of memory hierarchy, which we call
elements.2211.03251_960dd38bd6dcdb1326982633440ae: The compiler then automatically binds tensor format sub-arrays (positions, values, etc.) to Spatial memory types (which later become physical Capstan memory) using
elements.2211.03251_2f87e8eb521072951cf4053bcb74a: The automatic inference analysis is crucial in avoiding unwieldy end-user memory management, which would require decisions on the Cartesian combination of: the number of input tensors for a kernel, levels per tensor, sub-arrays per level format, and the memory analysis for each sub-array (which includes memory type matching, memory allocation, and multiple data transfer locations)
elements.2211.03251_f9f014a85c9cfb3f71deb05bbcfbe: Finally, CIN assignment nodes are lowered to inter-region data transfers (e.g., DRAM to SRAM loads and vice versa)
elements.2211.03251_ffc73c1ead8d40ac497ae36e01599: This analysis ensures that memory properties and preconditions are satisfied, ensuring valid placement of tensor arrays.
elements.2211.03251_3e75b8162d8cfdcd8970eec235fd5: emits tensor sub-array allocations and memory transfers during top-down CIN traversal, accounting for memory access patterns and physical properties
elements.2211.03251_471a0ffbe77f772c1bb2ee5e563fb: Fine-grained memory binding addresses multiple issues: 1) which physical memory type to allocate for a given tensor array, 2) where (in which pattern body) to allocate the chosen physical memory, and 3) where (in which pattern body) should our compiler emit inter-memory transfers
elements.2211.03251_6aa55d79504d0c3fe90cde806b08b: incompatible memory allocations, late allocations, and missed data transfers
elements.2211.03251_63e9f510405ef445aa296bc483b4a: will cause hardware simulation errors or invalid kernel computations
elements.2211.03251_48c4a85f318ce6733285ed9bade4b: The memory binding analysis does not consider array sizes since it allocates the maximal possible size for one unit of memory; it assumes every array will fit in this size constraint based on computation tiling to the accelerator as described by the scheduling language.
elements.2211.03251_8827895bc004a1f4af5a2bada8031: ensures the following preconditions when binding format sub-arrays of tensors to physical memory types:
elements.2211.03251_6ac4c1d2f849b83dcc977cb42e20c: Arrays of every off-chip tensor (input and output) are placed in dense DRAM initialized by the host.
elements.2211.03251_ac019168f3e051e43fe07cb8ad5cd: These provide an interface for direct off-chip random accesses of sparse data
elements.2211.03251_bfe46d10fd0ccccbd180de006b90a: This is useful when there is no identifiable working set to bring on-chip.
elements.2211.03251_0338a2d1a61592e55263670f2a70b: The system will only bind arrays with affine access patterns to dense SRAMs, including position arrays (addressed in an
elements.2211.03251_e22f4b86e73df5a4ba69185d45f2c: fashion) and values arrays of fully dense formats (generally traversed linearly).
elements.2211.03251_7094140ccf03765665629130e384e: The system binds any on-chip, small, fixed-size arrays that have an access pattern with reuse but random accesses to sparse SRAMs.
elements.2211.03251_85aaef2de5038146f5dcaaaefb35c: Bit vectors are special on-chip integer streams (

elements.2211.03251_20f7d336944e29f198b3ca3b2e560: Arrays accessed linearly with certain access patterns may be bound to (seemingly infinite) FIFO buffers
elements.2211.03251_5a9bc6f5ea3a0891191c46598ed5a: The compiler cannot enqueue excess data that is not popped, cannot pop data before its storage lifetime ends, and must pop the data precisely when the storage lifetime ends
elements.2211.03251_d3a0fc6f79e6afb73ae0fa2a7fdc3: This restricts FIFOs to coordinate arrays of sparse tensors and value arrays that are accessed in order.
elements.2211.03251_1d850aa8d5d89009965c76a616b45: On-chip scalar variables are bound to registers.
elements.2211.03251_c075361bcadbeba39f81f7ca0bb54: After the compiler has chosen an accelerator memory type for a tensor, it inserts code to allocate memory and to transfer data to and from the memory
elements.2211.03251_3ce85283e29c0b838179497874cbb: Tensor arrays are allocated at the loop level just above their first use, for ease of analysis, but hoisting them and inserting reset code between iterations is also possible
elements.2211.03251_42bb450004b1d67afaa7a012cb0f7: Sparse tensors have multiple index arrays and a value array whose data must be transferred to and/or from the accelerator

elements.2211.03251_028996ba7af06893956b003b8e922: Our lowering algorithm ensures tensors are filled with values before their use by making the following assumptions: 1) value-array elements are always accessed at the corresponding loop body of the innermost mode of a tensor, 2) coordinate array elements are always accessed at the index loop body corresponding to that mode, and 3) position array elements are always accessed one loop higher
elements.2211.03251_4d9782ab5741a87aa907ed69a9534: If a higher loop does not exist, the arrays are accessed at the start of the kernel
elements.2211.03251_63c6e537d838fea721b9593b9e6ef: All allocations occur before the loop header of the current loop (also the loop body of the preceding loop-nest), and all data transfers occur immediately after their associated allocations
elements.2211.03251_6a335a47f57b8abdd933a7d7b0628: Our lowering algorithm must access value elements at the loop body of a tensor's innermost mode and not lower in the loop-nest hierarchy
elements.2211.03251_c86a82a5e08cc043302ed89570fba: We may not assume that array elements are accessible anywhere after array declaration because this is not possible for memories that do not support random access
elements.2211.03251_1b79955622afdd72c76fc636d1ca5: Using a FIFO for an in-order traversal of the modes, for example, requires that the FIFO values be accessed precisely at the level of the last tensor mode and only used for one iteration of that loop.

elements.2211.03251_8a19f10a8e33aa1fa1b0b84f4f8c4: In many situations, DSAs and accelerators accelerate computation using streams of data
elements.2211.03251_0bac376282b8e631bf631d0fa92e0: These streams flow through functional hardware blocks that produce new output streams
elements.2211.03251_7501be9ae959b90aff3f44d5fd479: Because the blocks are functional mappings from input to output streams, general-purpose control flow statements like conditionals are no longer available, TACO's lowering machinery can no longer be used.
elements.2211.03251_f278b60f7128ce29bdce609665222: Sparse accelerators further speed up sparse tensor computations by contracting together tensor elements efficiently, and a good compiler must support these algorithms natively
elements.2211.03251_9286bde0484e983355b5dd5251573: For example, DSAs may have specialized hardware blocks with clever algorithms and optimized data structures to increase performance, such as the examples in
elements.2211.03251_6607da57ae378c344a8f329ee82a0: One such data structure is the bit-vector format, which densely packs sparse coordinate information
elements.2211.03251_93736d19fa0a515bcb471fcda9c72: The bit-vector format accelerates kernels by enabling hierarchical intersections using bit-vector trees, uncompressed blocked iteration of sparse data, and efficient tensor contractions using boolean logic.

// Spatial header code
...

// Initialize all DRAM arrays
val A2_pos_dram = DRAM[T](nnz_max)
...

Accel {
  val B2_pos = SRAM[T](nnz_accel_max)
  B2_pos load B2_pos_dram(0::(B1_dim + 1) par ip)
  Foreach (C1_dim by 1 par bp) { i =>
    val A_vals = FIFO[T](16)
    val A2_crd = FIFO[T](16)
    val A2_pos = SRAM[T](nnz_accel_max)
      
    val jB_start = B2_pos(i)
    val jB_end = B2_pos((i + 1))
    val jB_len = jB_end - jB_start

    val B2_crd = FIFO[T](16)
    B2_crd load B2_crd_dram(jB_start::jB_end par 1)
    val B_vals = FIFO[T](16)
    B_vals load B_vals_dram(jB_start::jB_end par 1)

    Foreach (jB_len by 1 par 1) { jB =>
      val j = B2_crd.deq
      val B_hoisted = B_vals.deq
        
      val D_vals = SRAM[T]((nnz_accel_max / 4))
      D_vals load D_vals_dram((j*D1_dim)::((j+1)*D1_dim) par ip)
      val C_vals = SRAM[T]((nnz_accel_max / 4))
      C_vals load C_vals_dram((i*C2_dim)::((i+1)*C2_dim) par ip)
        
      val tjA_vals = Reg[T](0.to[T])
      Reduce(tjA_vals)(D1_dim by 1 par ip) { k => 
        ((B_hoisted * C_vals(k)) * D_vals(k))
      } { _ + _ }
      A_vals.enq(tjA_vals)
      A2_crd.enq(j)
    }
    A2_pos(i + 1) = jB_end
    A_vals_dram stream_store_vec(jB_start, A_vals, jB_len)
  }
}
    \end{lstlisting}

        SDDMM Spatial code generated by \name.

elements.2211.03251_c4025e5843a02073ffdded9b76c86: For reference, Capstan is built as a grid of 200 vectorized compute units (PCUs) and 200 memory units (PMUs) that are ringed by 80 memory controllers (MCs), as shown in
elements.2211.03251_736820bf4e397f0608f721fe740f7: Each PCU has six stages and 16 vector lanes that can perform fixed or floating-point operations
elements.2211.03251_a8f488b6eea230cab19da7db5814c: Each PMU has 16 banks of 4096 32-bit words, supporting one read and one write per bank every cycle
elements.2211.03251_afca59909c2ef813ab2d9b96bc317: Capstan natively supports sparsity within its architecture by including sparse on-chip memory scheduling, fixed- and floating-point atomics, and sparse iteration over compressed bit-vector data structures
elements.2211.03251_2607e215beaf8fb21df7dfa0fb8c1: Additionally, 16 shuffle networks enable sparse accesses beyond the 16 lanes of a single PMU, but when used they limit the total number of outer-parallel iterations to 16
elements.2211.03251_3adb9ae33007c71ca196ca1777948: To make good use of Capstan's hardware, a compiler must be able to extract parallelism at both an inner-loop (vectorization) and outer-loop (cross-PCU) level
elements.2211.03251_e0d9666893cdb8a8fbde3c3defbc5: Outer-loop parallelism is harder to extract because it requires the compiler to explicitly distribute memories, including FIFOs which must be precisely enqueued and dequeued, across physically unrolled partitions
elements.2211.03251_8227531e0570274687db8adab1c89: Based on the nature of Capstan's distributed compute and memory resources, it is unlikely that an application could use 100
elements.2211.03251_30c33dfabe6fdde944be5e881593e: Limiting resources vary, but all applications except Plus2 make good use of resources via outer parallelization because they approach a limit in at least one dimension (compute, memory, or shuffle-network ports)
elements.2211.03251_a193330acceb5124ebe512e9cdafc: By hitting physical resource limits, the compiler ensures that users are able to take full advantage of Capstan
elements.2211.03251_1f449e7ed5b9c24c2489d09328067: One of the key factors in RDA (and GPU) out-performance is a high-bandwidth memory system
elements.2211.03251_431a4319e81758026fe26176d351b: Capstan has support for either HBM-2E and DDR4 random access memory.
elements.2211.03251_759247be0650496ae25e462b6565e: shows that our applications (excepting Plus2, which is not outer-parallelized) are able to make good use of DRAM bandwidth as well
elements.2211.03251_dd30847893ea97c2ed23380cbf1b4: This is a direct result of the decoupled access-execute memory model: factoring out off-chip memory accesses into large, bulk loads and stores exposes significant memory parallelism.

elements.2211.03251_ae5722459fbd3ffb7115d020f2941: The fact that our system is able to compile to applications where a hand-written Spatial implementation does not exist motivates the use of our automated compiler to generate the long tail of sparse tensor algebra kernels, which have practical applications, including deep neural networks (SDDMM), scientific computing (Plus3), linear least squares (Residual), and alternating least squares (MTTKRP).
elements.2211.03251_56a85c44be9b42379f27a9f091b32: is, to the best of our knowledge, the first compiler to compile a high-level sparse tensor algebra expression language to a general sparse domain-specific accelerator
elements.2211.03251_4e0f4716c95d5bf3e26dc43d70987: There is, however, prior work on sparse tensor algebra systems targeting CPUs and GPUs, compilers for dense image processing and neural network applications that target dense domain-specific architectures, other sparse domain-specific hardware that provides alternative targets for a compiler like ours, and different methodologies for programming these sparse DSAs.
elements.2211.03251_487378a034a6b9e39b21efdd45a5d: Several compilers have been proposed for sparse tensor algebra, but these compilers target CPUs
elements.2211.03251_16bd00b89f60dcf69bb4d0d665e45: , whereas our system compiles to domain-specific sparse data
elements.2211.03251_63b1e9c49080d747c93086a6d88c3: We chose to extend TACO with a compilation path to target RDAs since it contains input languages and IRs that support general tensor compression formats, optimizations, and expressions
elements.2211.03251_bbe0927130cdbba12eb7fc91e2cb5: TACO, unlike our system, defines co-iteration as only the intersection of tensor coordinates
elements.2211.03251_b37ac162ede84dcd491d3bb118a78: In order to support all tensor algebra expressions, TACO uses an iteration lattice IR to decompose all unions of coordinates into disjoint intersections and then emits code that performs a multi-way merge strategy, whereas
elements.2211.03251_cebdab08619675ee9e6e48739e663: emits scanners through logical operations on bit vectors.
elements.2211.03251_d0637d6880d866e848fa62591688f: Other architectures have been proposed for single-function sparse acceleration, including matrix-vector multiplication
elements.2211.03251_f4381883df5cebac2361c0eec8eb1: Prior work has also mapped algorithms like SpMV
elements.2211.03251_e757126841139c493c190a0d067eb: Because the compiler would not reconfigure the FPGA itself, pre-defined FPGA implementations would be exposed to the programmer in the same manner as an ASIC
elements.2211.03251_8f7882e8c116f7f44b81156f10dec: From a compiler perspective, these algorithms can all be considered as special-purpose lowering cases
elements.2211.03251_284427088164683be04063e58adb8: For example, a sparse matrix-matrix multiply could be mapped to our
elements.2211.03251_29fdaed2e47ede621e6ae4b621f29: We focused our evaluation on Capstan
elements.2211.03251_616db82f1a5427f746f169d1a9a96: because it is a flexible RDA with an easy-to-understand programming model: it supports vectorized sparse iteration with composable parallel patterns
elements.2211.03251_2ef00449cb2cafdefdeeb7051eef4: However, sparse iteration spaces are a general representation, and
elements.2211.03251_d85ed30d0722fe1fe80d66483a50a: could target any reconfigurable sparse accelerator with appropriate backend modifications
elements.2211.03251_85a086f4f2ea6ca6504395d77a5c5: are two recent sparse DSAs with different programming models than Capstan
elements.2211.03251_c36be03c4bb3bb03befa538a05686: Both have tiled architectures with explicit on-chip memory accesses, but they have different methods for combining sparse data
elements.2211.03251_e574cced4420528d9e30e86e9cdeb: The SPU uses a stream-join programming abstraction to combine sparse indices and a custom RDA fabric to perform the intersection operations
elements.2211.03251_14b86c2ac5eba946ba256c1bcd1e7: The core of stream-join is a conditional-dequeue abstraction with FIFO inputs: to lower to this abstraction, our compiler would have to rewrite CIN traversal using FIFO dequeues (instead of the pointer bumps and memory accesses used for CPU backends).
elements.2211.03251_f9eea0b2e116561004cdabf9951d2: Similarly, ExTensor uses a programming model based on hierarchical tensor intersectors; these are designed to provide high throughput for direct iteration on sparse data structures
elements.2211.03251_1145f99d78069c81df5af659c78ff: However, any compiler would still need to handle low-level mapping, including coordinating memory transfers.
elements.2211.03251_2bbd46bb6e9d2a818e05ffbfdafef: We have described the first compiler that automatically compiles arbitrary sparse tensor algebra kernels to sparse reconfigurable dataflow accelerator
elements.2211.03251_7cc29cee1d90c727c728505fc00ee: Since architects are developing many accelerators for sparse computations, we expect
elements.2211.03251_3972b9b38fbdd43571f5a12235e02: to be the first of many to target sparse accelerators
elements.2211.03251_91eb959b5ceae50576e1390acac41: leveraging the separation of application code from both data representation
elements.2211.03251_025dcc5da0e2f45f342ae51ef3377: schedules to independently map data to memories and (sparse) operations to sparse data combiners and compute units
elements.2211.03251_0cbb6eaf9b7a2c38f2a0d98778c3e: will influence future domain-specific compiler designs
elements.2211.03251_7a6e6e68614cdb0bcc4e15c7424fb: Finally, we plan to further extend our compiler path into a compiler toolkit that can be used to create sparse tensor algebra compiler backends for a host of emerging domain-specific sparse hardware.
